item.title: Junior & Summer Programme
item.dc:creator: admin

item.title: Who we are
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Who we are Welcome Ireland are an Irish company who believe in offering a quality English learning experience in Ireland. We work with some of the best schools in Ireland to offer you a memorable learning experience with an emphasis on Irish culture and we understand the needs of the English learner. All our partner schools are selected because of their high quality academic department, accreditations, premises, teachers, location and level of professionalism. All our schools are accredited by ACELS, Quality English and QQI and have many years experience. Welcome Ireland have over five years experience in the Irish education industry and our objective is to make your time in Dublin as positive and enjoyable as possible.

item.title: What we offer
item.dc:creator: admin

item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start blogging!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To delete a comment, just log in and view the post's comments. There you will have the option to edit or delete them.

item.title: Why Ireland
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Welcome Ireland is primarily an agency whose goal is to find you the best possible learning experience, tailor made for you. We will work closely with you in finding a suitable college, quality accommodation (Homestay, student accommodation, hotel, budget accommodation), transport and advice on living and studying in Ireland. Our schools and accommodation options are selected carefully as to offer you the best quality at the best price. We have over 5 years experience in this field and want to make your experience in Ireland one to remember for years to come. Our packages include the following;

item.title: Contact Us
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Contact Central Office Welcome Ireland 44 Annamoe Drive Dublin 7 Phone: +353 85 1853071 Email: graham@welcomeireland.ie Spanish Office Welcome Ireland c/ Avenue Diagonal 1008 Barcelona Phone: +353 85 1853071 Email: elena@welcomeireland.ie Russian enquiries: lana@welcomeireland.ie Middle East enquiries: abeer@welcomeireland.ie --------------------------------------------------------------

item.title: Work & Study
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
At Welcome Ireland we believe that the learning experience should be continued outside the classroom. It is with this in mind that we have designed our Work & Study Program to help you maximize your English, enjoy studying and working in Dublin and find quality employment in a range of industries. Internships give you the chance to work in a different country, practice your English and get a reference which will help your search for work on return to your own country.
Our Work & Study Programme involves a minimum six-week tuition period before commencement of internship. Other options regarding longer tuition periods and accommodation can be also be provided. Tuition takes place in a prestigious college in the centre of Dublin city. Internships take place in professional companies in a variety of industries such as Communication and Media, Finance and Accounting, Marketing and Business and Tourism (hotel and catering). Our Study & Work Programme is designed for the career-minded student. Participants are generally University students or young professionals seeking to obtain tangible experience in today’s fast paced working environment.
The application process generally takes six weeks from application to commencement of employment. The minimum age for internships is 18 and participants must have a minimum intermediate level (B1) of English. Minimum length of internship is four weeks. Our Work & Study Programme includes:
• 20 lessons per week • 6 weeks tuition • Registration fees • Internship placement fee • 6 weeks internship • Supporting documentation from company • Health Insurance • Airport pick-up 12 weeks program €3200.00

item.title: One Year Academic
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
One Year Academic (Atlas)
This program is designed for non-native students wishing to immerse themselves in Irish culture, master their English and enjoy Ireland on a one-year visa. Welcome Ireland offer an all-in-one service which includes consultation, application process, maintaining regular contact with our partner college and post-study support.
Once initial contact is made, we will listen to the needs and requirements of the student and design a programme which is tailor-made for the student. We have many years experience in helping students from such regions as Venezuela, Brazil, South Korea and Russia and the Middle East finding their perfect college programme. We also offer an accommodation service with such options as homestay, Student accommodation and apartment share.
The School
Our partner school is chosen for its academic merits, social program, location and ACELS accreditation. It is located within a ten minutes walk from the centre of Dublin and is positioned overlooking the Royal Canal in a beautiful part of Dublin City. While enjoying close proximity to the centre of town, it is also a five minutes walk to the leafy district of Rathmines, which due to it's student population is also famous for it's cafe's bars, shopping, libraries and Georgian architecture. Our One-Year Academic program includes
• 20 hours group tuition • Monday - Friday 9.00am to 1.10pm (General English Fluency) • 25 weeks tuition & 25 weeks holiday / work • Registration fees • Course book • Social and Cultural Program at discounted prices • Free access to afternoon electives • Free Wifi and computer room access • End of course certificate • Insurance • Airport pick-up
 
Aiport pick-up
 
One year - €3650.00

item.title: University
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
University Programme
University immersion programmes are a great way to study in Ireland, maximize your English learning experience and learn new skills. These skills can give you a competitive advantage in your home country or seeking to find a new life in Ireland. Once a student contacts Welcome Ireland, a member of our team will assess the needs of the student and then present several suitable colleges for you to choose based on these needs. To help you make your decision we will provide all the relevant course details, accreddiations and facilities in the college. Our in-depth knowledge of the Irish education system will hep you find your way in Ireland and find the perfect solution for your needs.
Applicants must have minimum level 5 IELTS.
Our University Programme includes:
• Full & Part-time university courses • Full consultation service from initial contact through to enrollment in your desired college • Sourcing a suitable college • Regular contact with the college on your behalf • Application process • Help with Irish government bodies • Visa assistance • Accommodation The Colleges
We can help you find work in a variety of colleges around Ireland, depending on your requirements. We understand the needs of the student and can recommend colleges based on their courses, location, academic department, facilities and accredditations. It is important your qualifications are recognized in your home countries so we will offer advice on the hierarchy of the Irish qualifications framework.
Accommodation
Working closely with the students financial and academic requirements, we will provide several accommodation options such as homestead, student accommodation and help finding apartment room shares.

item.title: Pre University Programme
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Pre-University Programme
This program is designed as a pathway program to studying in universities in Ireland and England. The programme is recognized by leading universities and over 80% of students who attend this course achieve their first choice of university place each year.
There are three core subjects (Maths always included) and these are chosen depending on the degree the student wants. The program is tailored towards the desired university course. The course content of these academic subjects is the same as the Irish Leaving Certificate and is of a high standard. Students are taught alongside Irish Leaving Certificate students with the same native teachers and class content. Teachers write the exams for the Pre-University program students.
Students also take EAP (English for Academic Purposes), Cultural Awareness classes and an IT module. Results are based on the end of year exams held in May, plus attendance and continuous assessment in each subject throughout the year. The exam allows entry to Irish and UK universities to study in such facilities as:
• Medicine • Dentistry • Law • Business • Accounting • Engineering • IT • Hotel Management • Science
The School
The program takes place in a highly prestigious establishment in the heart of Georgian Dublin, Ireland's capital city. Dublin is a young, exciting, cosmopolitan city with a population of over one million people. Although it is a busy city, it is quite small and friendly, clean and safe. Their teachers are renowned for:
• An established reputation for teaching excellence and dedication • A proven record of exam achievement by their students • Their commitment to the academic success of their students • Their energy and enthusiasm
The school also has on its team three qualified Career Guidance Counsellors, fully accredited by the Institute of Guidance Counsellors of Ireland. These counsellors are available for:
• Assistance with Irish & UK university applications • University options • Career planning • Interview skills • Personality & aptitude profiling
One Year €12,000.00

item.title: Professional
item.dc:creator: admin

item.title: Teacher Training
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Teacher Training Programme (Atlas)
Our Teacher Training programme is designed specifically with the teaching needs of non-native primary and secondary teachers in mind. They are language and teaching skills refresher courses that aim to improve teachers’ English language level. The courses also update and renew classroom skills and helping teachers keep up-to- date with recent changes in language methodologies. Teachers and academic support staff all work to create a school ethos and atmosphere that encourage the highest standards of work and learning. A vibrant social calendar allows you to experience Irish culture and and explore the city of Dublin and Ireland.
The School
Our partner school is chosen for its academic merits, social program, location and ACELS accreditation. It is located within a ten minutes walk from the centre of Dublin and is positioned overlooking the Royal Canal in a beautiful part of Dublin City. While enjoying close proximity to the centre of town, it is also a five minutes walk to the leafy district of Rathmines, which due to it's student population is also famous for it's cafe's bars, shopping, libraries and Georgian architecture.
Welcome Ireland also offer a range of accommodation options such as business class en-suite hotel rooms, home-stay with welcoming Irish families or city centre student accommodation.
• 20 hours General English per week • 5 hours small group tuition • Registration fees • Course book • Social and Cultural Program • Free access to afternoon electives • Free Wifi and computer room access • End of course certificate • Insurance • Airport pick-up
2 weeks -

item.title: Business English
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Business English
Welcome Ireland offers English language coaching programmes to executives who appreciate that advanced language skills are increasingly important to enhance workplace effectiveness. Our programmes are designed to meet specific business needs and aims to develop confident, articulate English-language communicators. We offer a range of accommodation options such as business class en-suite hotel rooms, home-stay with welcoming Irish families or city centre student accommodation.
Business English Silver Business English Gold --------------------------------------------------
Business English Silver (Atlas - Fluency & 5 hours business)
Business English Silver allows students to combine General English classes in the morning with 5 hours Business training in the afternoons. In addition there is a further one hour tutorial with their Business trainer to set goals and monitor progress.
• 20 hours General English per week • 5 hours small group tuition • Registration fees • Course book • Social and Cultural Program • Free access to afternoon electives • Free Wifi and computer room access • End of course certificate • Insurance • Airport pick-up
Format and Delivery The content and format of our business programme is determined following a diagnostic training needs’ consultancy with our clients. This comprises an initial language skills assessment and a discussion of the client’s specific needs and objectives. The School
Our partner school is chosen for its academic merits, social program, location and ACELS accreditation. It is located within a ten minutes walk from the centre of Dublin and is positioned overlooking the Royal Canal in a beautiful part of Dublin City. While enjoying close proximity to the centre of town, it is also a five minutes walk to the leafy district of Rathmines, which due to it's student population is also famous for it's cafe's bars, shopping, libraries and Georgian architecture.
2 weeks €700.00 --------------------------------------------------
Business English Gold (With Cambridge BEC International Qualification) (Malvern Business (With BEC Exam)
Business English Gold is structured identical to Business English Silver but also includes additional classes in Cambridge BEC. It’s a great opportunity to practise vital skills, inside or outside the classroom. We have built a programme that suits your needs and our specialist business teachers will ensure you develop the skills necessary to further your career. Language skills will include telephoning, making presentations, negotiating, emails, web conferencing and business correspondence and will generally improve your confidence when communicating in business. We offer this programme from Upper Intermediate level and students must take the online placement test after booking to join this class. Students may study General English until they have the correct level. Students attending this course may take the Cambridge BEC International Qualification, which is trusted and valued by universities, employers and professional bodies worldwide. Course consists of Standard 25 lessons, plus 2 afternoons (8 lessons) in the BEC.
• 25 hours General English per week • 8 Business English classes • Optional BEC Cambridge exam • Registration fees • Course book • Social and Cultural Program • Free access to afternoon electives • Free Wifi and computer room access • End of course certificate • Insurance • Airport pick-up
The School
The school is located on Dame Street in Dublin’s centre. It is across from the Central Bank, and beside Trinity College and Grafton Street, the main shopping area. It is ideally located for easy access to public transport systems where you will be able to visit Dublin centre. Dublin's famous cultural quarter Temple Bar sits opposite the school, which offers the student a variety of Dublin's finest cafe's, museums, venues and tourist sights right on your doorstep.
2 weeks €800.00 --------------------------------------------------

item.title: General English
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: General English Our General English programs are designed to offer quality tuition in the best schools with the best academic departments. Our courses take place in the major Cities of Dublin, Limerick, Galway and Cork. We have carefully chosen colleges which also offer exciting social activities such as scenic day trips, traditional Irish music nights and day tours to the best tourist locations in Ireland. Taking place in Dublin, Galway & Cork, our General English programmes cater for every type of learner from Beginner through to Advanced. The first half of the class involves the introduction of the grammar point and the second half involves practicing through conversation, role-play, games and group activity. On completion of the course students are graded and awarded the relevant certification. In addition to our General English program we also offer test preparation (Cambridge, IELTS etc.), Executive English and much more. All program takes place in schools which are very central, highly professional and ACELS accredited. We also offer a range of accommodation options such as business class en-suite hotel rooms, home-stay with welcoming Irish families or city centre student accommodation. Gold Package (Atlas) Accommodation includes full board and a private room with friendly Irish families who live within 30 minutes from the school. • 15 hours group tuition per week • Maximum 15 students per class • Homestay accommodation • Course materials • Social and sports program • Placement exam • Certificate of Attendance • Course completion certificate 2 weeks €800.00 Silver Package (Delfin) This option offers quality shared student accommodation in the centre of Dublin. • 15 hours group tuition per week • Maximum 15 students per class • Student accommodation • Course materials • Social and sports program • Placement exam • Certificate of Attendance • Course completion certificate 2 weeks €550.00

item.title: Over 50s
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Over 50's Programme (Malvern House)
Our Over 50s Explorer Programme is aimed at students who wish to enjoy some language lessons whilst having a truly unique Irish experience. As well as enjoying interesting English lessons, we offer a tailor-made social calendar with a range of events, excursions and opportunities for you to enjoy Irish culture a meet like-minded individuals. We can also offer a range of accommodation options such as business class en-suite hotel rooms, home-stay with welcoming Irish families or city centre accommodation. Aiport pick-up is included bringing you directly to your chosen accommodation. The School
The school is located on Dame Street in Dublin’s centre. It is across from the Central Bank, and beside Trinity College and Grafton Street, the main shopping area. It is ideally located for easy access to public transport systems where you will be able to visit Dublin centre. Dublin's famous cultural quarter Temple Bar sits opposite the school, which offers you a variety of Dublin's finest cafe's, museums, restaurants and tourist sights right on your doorstep.
Typical events include: • The Pasadena Roof Orchestra at the National Concert Hall • An Afternoon by the Sea in Howth Village • Master Classes on Irish History and Culture • Full Day Excursions to Glendalough and Kilkenny • Literary & Music Pub Tour • Irish Whiskey Trail
2 weeks - €750.00

item.title: Test Preparation
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Test Preparation Welcome Ireland offer a range of test preparation courses such as Cambridge FCE and CAE, TOEIC, and IELTS. Course options include a full-time FCE test preparation course, or alternatively a standard General course with an additional five test preparation classes in small groups. Courses feature specialist teachers experienced in training students to take a range of examinations. The courses are also monitored and designed by an Academic Manager who has many years experience teaching the Cambridge exams and is a Cambridge ESOL oral examiner. The School The school is chosen for its academic merits, social program, location and ACELS accreditation. It is located within a ten minutes walk from the centre of Dublin and is positioned overlooking the Royal Canal in a beautiful part of Dublin City. While enjoying close proximity to the centre of town, it is also a five minutes walk to the leafy district of Rathmines, which due to it's student population is also famous for it's cafe's bars, shopping, libraries and Georgian architecture. It has a dedicated social programme co-ordinator who organises activities, tours and visits throughout the year for our students. These activities are a scheduled part of almost all courses and normally occur after class in the afternoon and evening. Day and weekend trips to scenic areas outside Dublin, such as Connemara, Clare and Galway offer the student opportunities to practice their English and make new friends. ---------------------------------------- Full Time FCE Test Preparation • 20 hours FCE Preparation per week • Fixed start dates • Level - Upper-Intermediate • Full mock exam prepared and corrected to Cambridge standards • Social and Cultural Programme at discounted prices • Access to afternoon electives • Free Wifi and computer room access • End of Course Completion Certificate detailing student’s level The First Certificate of English (FCE) is a University of Cambridge ESOL examination designed for people who use everyday written and spoken English at an upper-intermediate level. The FCE examination is an extremely popular, internationally recognised qualification in English. The FCE examinations are held in Ireland in March, June, August and December. Exam fees not included. Please contact Welcome Ireland for course commencement and exam dates. Minimum four weeks tuition. 4 weeks €940.00 ---------------------------------------- General English & FCE • 20 hours group tuition + 5 hours small group FCE preparation per week • Fixed start dates • Level - Upper-Intermediate • Full mock exam prepared and corrected to Cambridge standards • Social and Cultural Programme at discounted prices • Access to afternoon electives • Free Wifi and computer room access • End of Course Completion Certificate detailing student’s level The First Certificate of English (FCE) is a University of Cambridge ESOL examination designed for people who use everyday written and spoken English at an upper-intermediate level. The FCE examination is an extremely popular, internationally recognised qualification in English. The FCE examinations are held in Ireland in March, June, August and December. Exam fees not included. Please contact Welcome Ireland for course commencement and exam dates. Minimum four weeks tuition. 4 weeks €1060.00 2 weeks €530.00 ---------------------------------------- General English & CAE • 20 hours group tuition + 5 hours small group CAE preparation per week • Level - Advanced • Full mock exam prepared and corrected to Cambridge standards • Social and Cultural Programme at discounted prices • Access to afternoon electives • Free Wifi and computer room access • End of Course Completion Certificate detailing student’s level This ‘plus’ option allows you take 5 hours small-group CAE (Certificate in Advanced English) preparation in addition to your General English Fluency classes in the morning. As with all our plus courses, afternoon classes are limited to a maximum of 6 people, meaning that you will have more time with your teacher, giving you the most focused preparation possible with experienced examination teachers. Exam fees not included. Please contact Welcome Ireland for course commencement and exam dates. Different tuition periods available on request. 4 weeks €1100.00 2 weeks €550.00 ---------------------------------------- General English & IELTS • 20 hours group tuition + 5 hours small group IELTS preparation per week • Level - Advanced • Full mock exam prepared and corrected to Cambridge standards • Social and Cultural Programme at discounted prices • Access to afternoon electives • Free Wifi and computer room access • End of Course Completion Certificate detailing student’s level This ‘plus’ option allows you take 5 hours small-group IELTS (International English Language Testing System) preparation in addition to your General English Fluency classes in the morning. As with all our plus courses, afternoon classes are limited to a maximum of 6 people, meaning that you will have more time with your teacher, giving you the most focused preparation possible with experienced examination teachers. Exam fees not included. Please contact Welcome Ireland for course commencement and exam dates. Different tuition periods available on request. 4 weeks €1060.00 2 weeks €530.00 ---------------------------------------- General English & TOEIC • 20 hours group tuition + 5 hours small group TOEIC preparation  / week • Level - Advanced • Full mock exam prepared and corrected to Cambridge standards • Social and Cultural Programme at discounted prices • Access to afternoon electives • Free Wifi and computer room access • End of Course Completion Certificate detailing student’s level This ‘plus’ option allows you take 5 hours small-group TOEIC preparation in addition to your General English Fluency classes in the morning. As with all our plus courses, afternoon classes are limited to a maximum of 6 people, meaning that you will have more time with your teacher, giving you the most focused preparation possible with experienced examination teachers. Exam fees not included. Please contact Welcome Ireland for course commencement and exam dates. Different tuition periods available on request. 4 weeks €1060.00 2 weeks €530.00 ----------------------------------------
